TopicTitle: What to do at school, WHEN DONE

Articles.Content: So... I'm here at school and I am bored. I finished my work. There is nothing to review. I just have the option of doing ST Math. I'm bored. PLUS Ji Ji is SO SLOW that I can type this without moving forward. I'm bored. We are supposed to watch a Movie when everyone else finishes their work BUT there is one kid left, who is playing a computer without finishing his work. (Ok ST math was when you finished your paper, like a not mandatory.) Great. My battery is 16 Percent.

Get off the phone?

Find something to learn all by yourself?

Find a book to read?

I actually usually end up doing math on my own when done in physics class.

Like for instance, recently I've been trying to figure out what gravity would be on Earth if there was no planetary rotation.
Look in the technology section of the library, and read a book on space. Or really, anything in the library.

Listen to some Pink Floyd...?

I like to do some simple trajectories and finding the equations for them. Not incorporatong drag, though...

Eat. And eat. And eat. Then speedwalk for twenty minutes. Before sunrise. Outside in the cold. Five days a week. Twice a day.

You said at school.
Ask the teacher for relevant material. Some will not be enthusiastic, but most will gladly provide some extra stuff to challenge you. They are there to help you

Do what I did: Take random bits of paper off the margins of your notebook and endlessly fold them until they fall apart at the creases. Or watch the clock and notice that every time you look at it the minutes hand never moves. Or just endlessly and aimlessly think and let your mind take you on an adventure. Or stare out the window and watch the people going by and commentate on them MST3K-style.

Or reread the book on the section you just took an exam on and yell "DAMMIT!" in your mind as you realize you got the answer(s) wrong to a/some question(s)
Sit there and be glad you're in school with too little to do, and not at work with a boss and customers that all think their stuff is so important that it needs to be done now.

Sit there and be glad you're in school with too little to do, and not at work with a boss and customers that all think their stuff is so important that it needs to be done now.

Do not be so sour, that people want to make more of themselves is only laudable. If you really detest a job that much, it is time to go look for something else.
Read literature written by the ancients. Homer, Virgil, and my main man Caesar all have great stories you can read.

Sit down, and think about the world, the universe, and if there is any definite good, any definite morality, and so on. Writing such thoughts down can be interesting as I have found that my views on the matter have changed quite dramatically. Or, if you are finding that the subject is boring for you, think of current technological developments and trends, or even better get a book on it and then think about it. Or, lastly, write poetry or draw things.
Create maths problems. Challenge people to solve them. Do it in a dramatic over the top style like in anime. Feel awesome for a few minutes before regretting it forever (or not).

Snitch on the last guy, then get beat up.

*Really bad humor, I know*

Noone to talk to? When i finished something early (or wasnt in the mood to do it at all since it wasnt challenging) i talked with friends, designed stuff for minecraft or KSP on paper or played on my phone...
Go play some old flash games on the computer.
